discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
To target subscribers who are not receiving too many emails but are engaging constantly with the emails sent to them, Northern Trail Outfitters should use:
• B. Einstein Engagement Frequency
Einstein Engagement Frequency helps identify the optimal number of emails to send to each subscriber to maximize engagement and minimize unsubscribes. This feature can help target subscribers who are highly engaged but not overwhelmed by too many emails, ensuring a balanced and effective email marketing strategy.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants to use an AI-based approach to target subscribers who are not receiving too many emails but are engaging constantly with the emails sent to them.

Which feature should help achieve this?

discussion.content:
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_es_send_classifications.htm&type=5

Send classifications define parameters for an email job in a central location. The account can reuse those parameters for multiple email send definitions. For example, an admin creates a send classification used every time a message containing a catalog sends to ensure that send always uses the appropriate parameters. Select a send classification, together with content information and audience information, when you define a message send by creating a message interaction.

Send classifications include these components.

Delivery Profile
Sender Profile
CAN-SPAM (Controlling the Assault of Non-Solicited Pornography and Marketing) classification

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters sends order confirmations to customers who have made online purchases. Delivery of these emails must follow the `Transactional` CAN-
SPAM requirements.
What feature should the marketer use?

discussion.content: so, which one? should we stick with C?

I would use reporting as the best source to compare campaigns. Tracking Extracts: Best for exporting raw tracking data for external use or archiving.
Data Views: Suited for in-platform analysis using SQL, segmenting audiences based on historical behavior, or populating custom data extensions.
Reporting: Provides visual insights into campaign performance and subscriber engagement, ideal for non-technical users and sharing results with stakeholders.
In essence, while Tracking Extracts, Data Views, and Reporting all provide insights into tracking data, they cater to different needs and levels of technical expertise. Reporting bridges the gap between raw data and actionable insights by offering visual representations of the data.
Tracking extract is correct as Data Views only hold 6 months data.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters' marketing department wants to review last year's holiday engagement to this year's engagement.

What should they use to access the historical engagement data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To automatically get data on a daily basis for monitoring the performance of emails across the company, Northern Trail Outfitters should use:
• A. Tracking Extracts
Tracking Extracts in Marketing Cloud allow you to extract detailed tracking data, such as email opens, clicks, bounces, and other engagement metrics, on a scheduled basis. This data can then be used to power dashboards and provide the analytics team with the insights they need.

Selected Answer: A
Should be Tracking Extracts

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters' analytics team has requested data to power a dashboard that can monitor the performance of emails across the company.

Which Marketing Cloud function should be used to get this data automatically on a daily basis?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
To test different subject line voices with a pilot group and then send the winning subject line to the remaining customers, the marketing manager should:
• B. Configure a Holdback group to be targeted by the winner.
By configuring a Holdback group in Path Optimizer, you can initially send the different subject lines to a smaller pilot group. Once the winning subject line is determined, the Holdback group (the remaining customers) can then be targeted with the winning subject line. This approach ensures that the majority of the audience receives the most effective subject line based on the test results.

I think " B" is the correct answer & here is the reason for it - ref (https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_jb_path_optimizer_test_activity.htm&type=5)
QUOTE
The Holdback feature is only available when you use the Run Once entry schedule type. Change the entry schedule type back to Run Once to activate the journey with a Holdback. If you want to use the Recurring schedule type, you must first change the entry schedule type back to Run Once, then remove the Holdback feature from Path Optimizer before activating your journey.
UNQUOTE

Selected Answer: A
A. Place a Random Split before Path Optimizer for the pilot group.

This option would allow for a specified percentage of the total audience to go through the Path Optimizer, which would test different subject lines on this subset (pilot group). The rest of the audience would not receive anything at this stage. This approach aligns with the requirement of first testing with a pilot group.

questions.question_text:
A marketing manager identified an upcoming email campaign for their team to test different subject line voices. They want to first test with a pilot group and then send the winning subject line out to the remaining customers.

How should Path Optimizer be configured to handle these requirements?

choices.C: Select winning path three days after journey activation.
choices.B: Configure a Holdback group to be targeted by the winner.
choices.A: Place a Random Split before Path Optimizer for the pilot group.
